title: 'Painful to watch': Biden leaves reporters hanging amid question blitz; team Trump shares video
content: President Joe Biden made a rare public appearance at the White House to discuss his 'Investing in America' agenda. He highlighted achievements like job growth and economic recovery. Reporters asked about various issues including Israel-Hamas conflict and high grocery prices. Smiling, Biden avoided their questions and exited the room with a polite 'Thank you, press.'
summary: President Joe Biden made a rare public appearance at the White House to discuss his 'Investing in America' agenda. He highlighted achievements like job growth and economic recovery. Reporters asked about various issues including Israel-Hamas conflict and high grocery prices. Smiling, Biden avoided their questions and exited the room with a polite 'Thank you, press.'

title: 4 Indians killed in Texas crash
content: In Anna city, Texas, four Indians died when their SUV burst into flames following a multi-vehicle crash involving a speeding truck. The victims were Aryan Raghunath Orampati, Farooq Shaik, Lokesh Palacharla, and Darshini Vasudevan. Authorities are conducting DNA fingerprinting to confirm their identities as the bodies were charred beyond recognition.
summary: In Anna city, Texas, four Indians died when their SUV burst into flames following a multi-vehicle crash involving a speeding truck. The victims were Aryan Raghunath Orampati, Farooq Shaik, Lokesh Palacharla, and Darshini Vasudevan. Authorities are conducting DNA fingerprinting to confirm their identities as the bodies were charred beyond recognition.

title: Government reshuffle in Ukraine: Key ministers step down amid conflict with Russia
content: In Ukraine, a significant government reshuffle occurred with key ministers resigning amid the ongoing conflict with Russia. President Zelenskyy aims to fill these positions before his US visit to present a 'victory plan' to President Biden. This reshuffle is crucial for strengthening Ukraine's state institutions during the important autumn season.
summary: In Ukraine, a significant government reshuffle occurred with key ministers resigning amid the ongoing conflict with Russia. President Zelenskyy aims to fill these positions before his US visit to present a 'victory plan' to President Biden. This reshuffle is crucial for strengthening Ukraine's state institutions during the important autumn season.

title: Sharif: Hopeful of bailout approval by IMF board
content: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif revealed that Pakistan is actively implementing the IMF's conditions for a $7-billion loan agreement secured in July. The government has introduced measures to enhance tax collection and revenue, including a tax-heavy budget and higher energy tariffs. Sharif expressed optimism about gaining approval from the IMF's executive board.
summary: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif revealed that Pakistan is actively implementing the IMF's conditions for a $7-billion loan agreement secured in July. The government has introduced measures to enhance tax collection and revenue, including a tax-heavy budget and higher energy tariffs. Sharif expressed optimism about gaining approval from the IMF's executive board.

title: Jailbreak bid leaves 129 dead at Congo prison
Cathay finds 15 planes need engine repairs
Korean staple kimchi faces climate threat
US justice department charges Hamas leaders over deadly October 7 attack on Israel
content: The US justice department has charged Yahya Sinwar and other key Hamas figures for their roles in the October 7, 2023 attack on Israel. Accusations include conspiracy to support terrorism and murder of US citizens. Despite challenges in apprehending them, this action aims to hold Hamas accountable for decades of alleged attacks.
summary: The US justice department has charged Yahya Sinwar and other key Hamas figures for their roles in the October 7, 2023 attack on Israel. Accusations include conspiracy to support terrorism and murder of US citizens. Despite challenges in apprehending them, this action aims to hold Hamas accountable for decades of alleged attacks.

title: 5 children arrested for murder after 80-year-old British-Indian dog walker attacked in park
What's so special about Kamala Harris' tan suit that Obama's didn't have
content: Kamala Harris donned a tan suit at the Democratic National Convention, mirroring Barack Obama's controversial fashion choice from ten years ago. While Obama's suit faced criticism, Harris's decision is interpreted as a confident statement. Obama too took note how his tan suit got a makeover and made a reappearance through Harris.
summary: Kamala Harris donned a tan suit at the Democratic National Convention, mirroring Barack Obama's controversial fashion choice from ten years ago. While Obama's suit faced criticism, Harris's decision is interpreted as a confident statement. Obama too took note how his tan suit got a makeover and made a reappearance through Harris.

title: Trump says he'd release Jeffrey Epstein files: 'Fortunately, I was not...'
content: "He (Epstein) was a good salesman. He was a hale and hearty type of a guy. He had some nice assets that he'd throw around like islands. But a lot of big people went to that island. But fortunately I was not one of them," Trump said adding that Kennedy files are very different from Epstein files but he would be inclined to release the latter as well as he has no problem.
summary: "He (Epstein) was a good salesman. He was a hale and hearty type of a guy. He had some nice assets that he'd throw around like islands. But a lot of big people went to that island. But fortunately I was not one of them," Trump said adding that Kennedy files are very different from Epstein files but he would be inclined to release the latter as well as he has no problem.

title: Nepal plans to issue new banknotes featuring disputed territories with India within a year: Report
content: Nepal's central bank is proceeding with plans to print new banknotes featuring a revised map that includes disputed territories with India, such as Kalapani, Lipulekh, and Limpiyadhura. This initiative follows a cabinet decision led by former Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal 'Prachanda' and aims for completion within six months to one year.
summary: Nepal's central bank is proceeding with plans to print new banknotes featuring a revised map that includes disputed territories with India, such as Kalapani, Lipulekh, and Limpiyadhura. This initiative follows a cabinet decision led by former Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal 'Prachanda' and aims for completion within six months to one year.

title: Kash Patel predicts major power grid attack in US before election: 'Something's gonna happen'
content: Kash Patel, an ex-Trump administration official, has forecasted a major power grid attack in the US coinciding with the election cycle. Speaking on a podcast, he said the intel community right now is playing catch up on half these attacks because it wasn't a priority to preemptively detect them and thwart the attack.
summary: Kash Patel, an ex-Trump administration official, has forecasted a major power grid attack in the US coinciding with the election cycle. Speaking on a podcast, he said the intel community right now is playing catch up on half these attacks because it wasn't a priority to preemptively detect them and thwart the attack.

title: Former aide to New York's guv, husband arrested: 'Undisclosed agent of China govt'
content: Linda Sun, former deputy chief of staff to New York Governor Kathy Hochul, faces charges for acting as an undisclosed agent for the Chinese government. Along with her husband Chris Hu, she was arrested at their Long Island home. They are accused of blocking Taiwanese officials and laundering money from China to buy a $4.1 million property.
summary: Linda Sun, former deputy chief of staff to New York Governor Kathy Hochul, faces charges for acting as an undisclosed agent for the Chinese government. Along with her husband Chris Hu, she was arrested at their Long Island home. They are accused of blocking Taiwanese officials and laundering money from China to buy a $4.1 million property.

title: Elon Musk says friends of his mother assaulted thrice this year in New York
content: Elon Musk, who supports Donald Trump for the November election, criticized migrant-related crimes in NYC, sharing a report that claims 75% of recent arrests in Midtown involve migrants. Musk said friends of his mother were assaulted thrice this year in New York with the offenders getting no punishment at all.
summary: Elon Musk, who supports Donald Trump for the November election, criticized migrant-related crimes in NYC, sharing a report that claims 75% of recent arrests in Midtown involve migrants. Musk said friends of his mother were assaulted thrice this year in New York with the offenders getting no punishment at all.

title: No concrete step on Turkey Brics membership, Erdogan's party says
content: Turkey has shown interest in joining the Brics group of emerging economies but has not yet taken concrete steps. The group includes Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa, Ethiopia, Iran, Egypt and the UAE. This development raises concerns among Western allies about Turkey's geopolitical orientation and commitment to Nato responsibilities.
summary: Turkey has shown interest in joining the Brics group of emerging economies but has not yet taken concrete steps. The group includes Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa, Ethiopia, Iran, Egypt and the UAE. This development raises concerns among Western allies about Turkey's geopolitical orientation and commitment to Nato responsibilities.

title: Tech magnate goes full MAGA: Elon Musk backs Trump all the way
content: Elon Musk has declared his support for Donald Trump, calling the Democratic Party criminals and posting an AI-generated image of Kamala Harris in a communist outfit without clarification. He expressed interest in joining a potential Trump administration to cut wasteful government programs. Musk's stance on free speech has led to significant criticism and controversy.
summary: Elon Musk has declared his support for Donald Trump, calling the Democratic Party criminals and posting an AI-generated image of Kamala Harris in a communist outfit without clarification. He expressed interest in joining a potential Trump administration to cut wasteful government programs. Musk's stance on free speech has led to significant criticism and controversy.

title: 'This aint Colorado': Venezuelan gang now taking over Chicago apartment?
content: An audio clip of a 911 call has gone viral, alleging that a Venezuelan gang took over an apartment complex in Chicago. Despite police intervention, no suspects were apprehended. This follows a similar incident in Colorado, which authorities have dismissed as exaggerated. Social media reactions have been intense, with calls for stronger action.
summary: An audio clip of a 911 call has gone viral, alleging that a Venezuelan gang took over an apartment complex in Chicago. Despite police intervention, no suspects were apprehended. This follows a similar incident in Colorado, which authorities have dismissed as exaggerated. Social media reactions have been intense, with calls for stronger action.

title: JD Vance has done 94 interviews since VP nomination as his strategy is...
content: An Axios report said Vance has done 94 interviews, press conferences and gaggles with the media and has actively courted adversarial outlets that Republicans often avoid. According to a campaign count, Vance has give nearly as many as interviews to traditional media outlets as he has to conservative media. Vance did all five major Sunday shows in the past month, including three of them in one day.
summary: An Axios report said Vance has done 94 interviews, press conferences and gaggles with the media and has actively courted adversarial outlets that Republicans often avoid. According to a campaign count, Vance has give nearly as many as interviews to traditional media outlets as he has to conservative media. Vance did all five major Sunday shows in the past month, including three of them in one day.

title: Netanyahu refuses to budge on war despite protests over hostages
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu continues his hard-line approach on Hamas despite protests over the killing of six hostages. The US calls for a cease-fire, and the UK suspends some arms licenses. Protesters demand more concessions in truce talks to secure the release of remaining abductees and pause the long-standing conflict.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu continues his hard-line approach on Hamas despite protests over the killing of six hostages. The US calls for a cease-fire, and the UK suspends some arms licenses. Protesters demand more concessions in truce talks to secure the release of remaining abductees and pause the long-standing conflict.
